title: 13.4.1 SSL/TLS certificate setup (ACM)
body:
# Objective
Obtain and configure SSL/TLS certificates from AWS Certificate Manager for secure HTTPS communication.

## Requirements
- Request SSL certificate from ACM for production domain
- Validate domain ownership (DNS or email)
- Configure certificate on Application Load Balancer
- Set up automatic certificate renewal
- Enforce HTTPS-only access (redirect HTTP to HTTPS)
- Configure TLS 1.2+ only (disable older versions)
- Set up HSTS headers for security
- Add certificate to CloudFront if using CDN
- Monitor certificate expiration
- Document certificate management procedures

## Acceptance Criteria
- SSL certificate issued and validated
- Certificate attached to ALB
- HTTPS working for all endpoints
- HTTP automatically redirects to HTTPS
- TLS 1.2+ enforced (no SSLv3, TLS 1.0, 1.1)
- HSTS header configured with 1-year max-age
- Certificate auto-renewal working
- SSL Labs test score A or A+
- Monitoring alerts 30 days before expiry

## Dependencies
- Parent: Epic 13 (#131)
- Requires: #145 (ALB setup)
- Required for: Production launch

## Estimated Effort
**Story Points:** 3
**Time:** 3 days
**Complexity:** Low-Medium
